meanings.definition: Make an aggressive growl or sound showing teeth.
meanings.sent1: The dog was snarling at the stranger approaching its territory.
meanings.sent2: The bear was snarling loudly as it defended its cubs.
meanings.sent3: The snarling cat made the mice scurry away in fear.
meanings.sent4: The storm outside sounded like a snarling beast, shaking the windows.
meanings.sent5: The snarling wind whipped through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: Utter in a fierce or angry manner.
meanings.sent1: The angry customer was snarling complaints at the manager.
meanings.sent2: The politician was snarling accusations during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The snarling toddler demanded more cookies from his mom.
meanings.sent4: The snarling engine of the old car refused to start.
meanings.sent5: The snarling thunder echoed through the valley, signaling an approaching storm.
